intro: Rosa coriifolia var. parcensis, commonly known as the Parcens rose, is a compact shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in shades of pink and white. The plant has thorny stems and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
